sources.title: Trinity Is Still My Name (1971) Terence Hill & Bud Spencer Are Back! Spaghetti Western - 4K
sources.description:
When Trinity’s lazy genius and Bambino’s brawn collide with a stolen fortune map, their sibling shenanigans spark a gold-laden showdown with scheming outlaws and Sheriff Mitch’s eye-twitching patience. But as their bumbling father’s “helpful” advice backfires and Perla’s fiery fists join the fray, the brothers flip chaos into victory—proving even holy water can’t wash away their knack for troublemaking and treasure-taking.


Title: Trinity Is Still My Name (1971)
Original title: ...continuavano a chiamarlo Trinità

Alternative titles: They Kept Calling Him Trinity (literal translation), Vier Fäuste für ein Halleluja (German release)

Director: Enzo Barboni (as E.B. Clucher)
Writers: Enzo Barboni, Gene Luotto

Main cast:
Terence Hill — Trinity
Bud Spencer — Bambino
Yanti Somer — Perla (the farmer’s daughter)
Harry Carey Jr. — Trinity and Bambino’s father
Jessica Dublin — Farrah (their mother)
Enzo Tarascio — Mitch, The Sheriff
Pupo De Luca — Prior (head monk)

Genres: Spaghetti Western, Comedy, Parody
Release date: October 21, 1971 
Filming location: Abruzzo, Italy

metadata.Plot: A couple of two-bit thieving brothers try and keep a promise to their dying father: stick together and become successful outlaws. Bambino reluctantly agrees to show younger Trinity the ropes, but their gentle demeanors tend to diminish their haul by repeatedly helping the selfsame family they initially held up. Fun ensues in town and at the local Spanish mission where they are taken for federal agents, mistakenly so identified by Trinity's young love interest, daughter of the aforementioned family.
metadata.Actors: Terence Hill, Bud Spencer, Yanti Somer
